programme.title: The Voyage Of Ghibellina - Episode 2
programme.desc: In this episode, we will visit the Sicilian archipelago: the Aeolian islands. We dive into its beautiful landsdcape, villages of small white buildings and lush vegetation. These seven small islands are home to two active volcanos, Vulcano and Stromboli, and the reefs testify the many geological upheavals they have suffered. Enjoy the breathtaking sunrise as we leave the island of Stromboli.

programme.title: The Smoke that Thunders
programme.desc: In 1855, the Scottish explorer David Livingstone named the Victoria Falls after his reigning queen. However, the Kalolo-Lozi people had their own name for it: Mosi-oa-Tunya, “the smoke that thunders”.Staring down into the depths of the mighty Zambezi River from the top of the world’s largest waterfall, the Victoria Falls, world-class divers Orlando Duque and Jonathan Paredes prepare for the most challenging dive of their lives.Be part of their adventure as they dive into the largest waterfall in the world in The Smoke that Thunders, available on Nautical Channel.

programme.desc: The AquaX competition continues its Round 2 on Cocoa Beach, Florida. Jet skies rush into the water at vertiginous speeds in the latest competition of the Championship. programme.title: Sailing Fever In Annapolis
programme.desc: Welcome to Annapolis!Maryland’s capital city and located on Chesapeake, its historic district includes houses from the 18th century. Besides its historical interest, the city is one of the most exciting places to go to in the United States for nautical sports as yearly hundreds of enthusiasts come here for recreational or competitive races and regattas. Host Lucia Metzbauer heads to the Chesapeake Bay to discover what makes it one of the USA's top sailing destinations. Be part of an exciting regatta, visit the prestigious Yacht Club, meet the locals to enjoy steam crabs and work on your balance with Yoga on a Paddleboard – so many different things going on in this charming seaport. Join Lucia for a journey into American maritime history and an exclusive look at the famous 2014 Annapolis Spring Sailboat Show.

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 5
programme.desc: First stop for this episode is the exotic destination and kiteboarding playground of Mauritius, for one of the most high-profile and biggest kite-foiling events: the Hydrofoil Pro Tour. From one island to another, we leave the exotic racetracks of Mauritius and head to Cagliari on Sardinia for another exciting gathering of the world's best kitefoiling riders. The World Championship also marked the close of the 2017 Kitefoil Gold Cup World Series.

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 6
programme.desc: In this episode, we move to Dongshan, China for the 2017 Dongshan China International Kiteboarding Open. Combining culture with heritage, this small island, located along the Taiwan Strait, hosts a population of 200,000. The Youth Olympic Games is a hot topic in the Kiteboarding community, eagerly anticipated by riders and supporters. Reflecting an exciting and new race format, the slalom/boarder-cross is designed to challenge the riders' ability to stay in control, while maintaining maximum speed.

programme.title: PRADA 36th America's Cup - Highlight
programme.desc: The moment everyone was waiting for has arrived: the 36th America’s Cup has started. Postponed a couple of days due to restrictions, it has finally started with a big start. The defender team started the day with an aggressive start and taking the lead, but Luna Rossa Prada Pirelli came to win this competition. What will happen at the end of this day? Watch the highlights of the competition.

programme.title: Cape Verdean Kite Crossing
programme.desc: Mitu Monteiro, a Cape Verdean kitesurfer and multi-time world champion, attempts the solo crossing of the twelve volcanic islands of his native archipelago, never accomplished before.Taking on more than 730km of kitesurfing, interspersed with island traverses by only man-powered means totalling approximately 200km, Mitu’s challenges lay ahead of him. With a total trajectory of nearly 1,000km and a route that had to be thought and rethought due to wind direction, shark infested waters, and distances that push this athlete to his limit, sweat will flow and his nerves will surely be put to the test.Mitu’s maverick journey across marvellous Atlantic waters and beaches, through inhospitable lunar landscapes and the lush vegetation of the volcanic islands is truly a SURFARI on a kite. Relive the whole experience on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: Facing Waves - Ep9 - Kayaking Ontario’s Highlands
programme.desc: Ken Whiting continues his paddling adventures as he explores the remote lakes and rivers of Ontario’s Highlands.

programme.title: Facing Waves - Ep10 - Kayaking the Okefenokee National Wildlife Refuge - Part Two
programme.desc: Ken Whiting goes deep into the alligator-filled waters of the Okefenokee swamp on a 3-day kayak camping trip.

programme.title: A Date with the Strait
programme.desc: The Bass Strait is a strip of water that divides the Australian mainland from Tasmania. Knowing that wild storms make the strait twice as rough as the English Channel, sailors stand in awe of the strong currents.In a death-defying act, two Aussies and a young Californian kneeling on their boards brave the 300 km/186.5mi paddle across the Bass Strait. Their adventure lasts several days with stops on small islands along the way. Apart from sharks, currents and threatening waves, win-or-bust Zeb Walsh, Brad Gaul and Jack Bark face sickness, sore muscles and dehydration. Follow their journey on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: International Canoe Federation World Cup - Sprint 2 World Cup Duisburg
programme.desc: We are in Duisburg, Germany, for the second ICF Canoe Sprint World Cup of 2019. Those who raced in Poznan last weekend had a big opportunity to lay down a marker and get the international respect, and now they have one more time to push themselves to the limit and improve their rankings before the World Championships in Hungary. Dive into the second leg of the 2019 Sprint World Cup, in Duisburg.

Enjoy the breathtaking sunrise as we leave the island of Stromboli.

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 5
programme.desc: First stop for this episode is the exotic destination and kiteboarding playground of Mauritius, for one of the most high-profile and biggest kite-foiling events: the Hydrofoil Pro Tour. From one island to another, we leave the exotic racetracks of Mauritius and head to Cagliari on Sardinia for another exciting gathering of the world's best kitefoiling riders. The World Championship also marked the close of the 2017 Kitefoil Gold Cup World Series.

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 6
programme.desc: In this episode, we move to Dongshan, China for the 2017 Dongshan China International Kiteboarding Open. Combining culture with heritage, this small island, located along the Taiwan Strait, hosts a population of 200,000. The Youth Olympic Games is a hot topic in the Kiteboarding community, eagerly anticipated by riders and supporters. Reflecting an exciting and new race format, the slalom/boarder-cross is designed to challenge the riders' ability to stay in control, while maintaining maximum speed.

programme.title: A Date with the Strait
programme.desc: The Bass Strait is a strip of water that divides the Australian mainland from Tasmania. Knowing that wild storms make the strait twice as rough as the English Channel, sailors stand in awe of the strong currents.In a death-defying act, two Aussies and a young Californian kneeling on their boards brave the 300 km/186.5mi paddle across the Bass Strait. Their adventure lasts several days with stops on small islands along the way. Apart from sharks, currents and threatening waves, win-or-bust Zeb Walsh, Brad Gaul and Jack Bark face sickness, sore muscles and dehydration. Follow their journey on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: Sailing Fever In Annapolis
programme.desc: Welcome to Annapolis!Maryland’s capital city and located on Chesapeake, its historic district includes houses from the 18th century. Besides its historical interest, the city is one of the most exciting places to go to in the United States for nautical sports as yearly hundreds of enthusiasts come here for recreational or competitive races and regattas. Host Lucia Metzbauer heads to the Chesapeake Bay to discover what makes it one of the USA's top sailing destinations. Be part of an exciting regatta, visit the prestigious Yacht Club, meet the locals to enjoy steam crabs and work on your balance with Yoga on a Paddleboard – so many different things going on in this charming seaport. Join Lucia for a journey into American maritime history and an exclusive look at the famous 2014 Annapolis Spring Sailboat Show.

programme.title: International Canoe Federation World Cup - Sprint 3 World Championships Szeged
programme.desc: Welcome to the Canoe Sprint World Championships 2019 celebrated in Szeged, Hungary! Today there are about 1,200 athletes racing from approximately 98 nations, meaning this is the biggest World Championships canoe sprint racing has ever seen. We're about to witness the fastest paddlers on the planet battle it out for medals, for World Championship glory, and to qualify for their country at the Tokyo 2020 Olympic Games. Enjoy the best moments at Szeged on the 2019 Sprint World Championships.

programme.title: Sailing Fever In Annapolis
programme.desc: Welcome to Annapolis!Maryland’s capital city and located on Chesapeake, its historic district includes houses from the 18th century. Besides its historical interest, the city is one of the most exciting places to go to in the United States for nautical sports as yearly hundreds of enthusiasts come here for recreational or competitive races and regattas. Host Lucia Metzbauer heads to the Chesapeake Bay to discover what makes it one of the USA's top sailing destinations. Be part of an exciting regatta, visit the prestigious Yacht Club, meet the locals to enjoy steam crabs and work on your balance with Yoga on a Paddleboard – so many different things going on in this charming seaport. Join Lucia for a journey into American maritime history and an exclusive look at the famous 2014 Annapolis Spring Sailboat Show.

programme.title: Cape Verdean Kite Crossing
programme.desc: Mitu Monteiro, a Cape Verdean kitesurfer and multi-time world champion, attempts the solo crossing of the twelve volcanic islands of his native archipelago, never accomplished before.Taking on more than 730km of kitesurfing, interspersed with island traverses by only man-powered means totalling approximately 200km, Mitu’s challenges lay ahead of him. With a total trajectory of nearly 1,000km and a route that had to be thought and rethought due to wind direction, shark infested waters, and distances that push this athlete to his limit, sweat will flow and his nerves will surely be put to the test.Mitu’s maverick journey across marvellous Atlantic waters and beaches, through inhospitable lunar landscapes and the lush vegetation of the volcanic islands is truly a SURFARI on a kite. Relive the whole experience on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: A Date with the Strait

Apart from sharks, currents and threatening waves, win-or-bust Zeb Walsh, Brad Gaul and Jack Bark face sickness, sore muscles and dehydration. Follow their journey on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: Sails In Sardinia
programme.desc: Sails in Sardinia takes us to the beautiful Italian island of Sardinia, the sescond largest island in the Mediterranean Sea, to visit the Yacht Club Costa Smeralda, in Porto Cervo. Known for being visited by the rich and famous, it also has a unique sailing history. We will get the true essence of competitive sailing at the Audi Settimana Delle Bocche, where the last leg of the TP52 Super Series is being held. We are meeting Ricardo Bonadeo, Commodore of the yacht club, to understand better how the 1967 non-profit organization has become today a world's leading organizer in international sailing events. Join Andi Van Zyl as she heads to the beautiful Costa Smeralda and interviews other big sailing personalities as Francesco Bruni and Terry Hutchinson, on Sails in Sardinia.

programme.title: Semaine Du Golfe Du Morbihan
programme.desc: The Semaine du Golfe Du Morbihan is an essential event for all classic sailing lovers. The Gulf Week is a maritime even set on the beautiful Morbihan Gulf, in Brittany, a French destination known for its gorgeous landscape. Expending on 35000 hectares, it is worth is reputation as the little sea. For one week, the Gulf will be letting more than 1000 ships rip through its waters. Rowing boats, lightships, classic sailing ships... almost 6000 sailors will take part in this year's edition. This joyful week has been organised in order to meet and share new experiences, so let's enduge in the best moments, most impressive boats and latest news of the 7th edition of the Semaine du Golfe Du Morbihan!

programme.title: FUN FOIL FEST - España Mar Menor - Los Alcázares
programme.desc: - Array

programme.title: Garrett McNamara & The Essence Of Big Wave
programme.desc: Garrett ‘GMAC’ McNamara is the American professional big wave surfer and extreme waterman known for breaking the world record for the largest wave ever surfed at Nazaré, Portugal. Surviving monstrous waves at Jaws, riding tsunamis from calving glaciers in Alaska and many more feats that are impossible to even imagine for many.Catch this exclusive half-hour special of Garrett McNamara & The Essence of Big Wave to understand his drive to get into the water despite knowing he’s risking his life. Find out more about his struggles, life-changing decisions, and the injuries that have made him become the legend he is today. From his earliest surfing days in Hawaii to world record success G-Mac tells it all.

programme.title: Rolex Spirit Of Yachting - Ep.3 - Maxi Yacht Rolex Cup
programme.desc: - Array

programme.title: Vendée Globe Weekly Highlights - Episode 9
programme.desc: - Array

programme.title: Stockholm Archipelago Raid
programme.desc: The Stockholm Archipelago Raid is for participants a unique orienteering race in Europe as it offers a mix of sport, nature and adventure to athletes. This archipelago is the largest in Europe, with 36,000 rocks, skerries and islands, as well as one of the most difficult for navigation. There are still islands and groups of islands where no sail race has ever passed due to their remote location or because they are bird or seal protection areas.Experienced sailors from all over the world gather in the heart of Sweden as it hosts the first F18 Raid World ever. Winners will be crowned as the best long distance F18 raid sailors in the world, marking history in this nautical sport.Watch the Stockholm Archipelago Raid on Nautical Channel and discover the limitless possibilities of this Raid for brave competitors that will race in these remote islands.

This joyful week has been organised in order to meet and share new experiences, so let's enduge in the best moments, most impressive boats and latest news of the 7th edition of the Semaine du Golfe Du Morbihan!

programme.title: P1 USA UIM Class 1 - Episode 4 - Sarasota
programme.desc: - Array

programme.title: P1 USA AquaX - Episode 3 Sarasota, FL
programme.desc: We move to the third round of the AquaX USA Championship that is taking place in Sarasota, FL. Riders will give their all once more in this event filled with adrenaline, power and the ultimate endurance racing. This year, competition is harder than ever as the top participants have been preparing hard for this championship and they are not ready to leave emptyhanded.

programme.title: Cape Verdean Kite Crossing
programme.desc: Mitu Monteiro, a Cape Verdean kitesurfer and multi-time world champion, attempts the solo crossing of the twelve volcanic islands of his native archipelago, never accomplished before.Taking on more than 730km of kitesurfing, interspersed with island traverses by only man-powered means totalling approximately 200km, Mitu’s challenges lay ahead of him. With a total trajectory of nearly 1,000km and a route that had to be thought and rethought due to wind direction, shark infested waters, and distances that push this athlete to his limit, sweat will flow and his nerves will surely be put to the test.Mitu’s maverick journey across marvellous Atlantic waters and beaches, through inhospitable lunar landscapes and the lush vegetation of the volcanic islands is truly a SURFARI on a kite. Relive the whole experience on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 5
programme.desc: First stop for this episode is the exotic destination and kiteboarding playground of Mauritius, for one of the most high-profile and biggest kite-foiling events: the Hydrofoil Pro Tour. From one island to another, we leave the exotic racetracks of Mauritius and head to Cagliari on Sardinia for another exciting gathering of the world's best kitefoiling riders. The World Championship also marked the close of the 2017 Kitefoil Gold Cup World Series.

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 6
programme.desc: In this episode, we move to Dongshan, China for the 2017 Dongshan China International Kiteboarding Open. Combining culture with heritage, this small island, located along the Taiwan Strait, hosts a population of 200,000. The Youth Olympic Games is a hot topic in the Kiteboarding community, eagerly anticipated by riders and supporters. Reflecting an exciting and new race format, the slalom/boarder-cross is designed to challenge the riders' ability to stay in control, while maintaining maximum speed.

programme.title: A Date with the Strait
programme.desc: The Bass Strait is a strip of water that divides the Australian mainland from Tasmania. Knowing that wild storms make the strait twice as rough as the English Channel, sailors stand in awe of the strong currents.In a death-defying act, two Aussies and a young Californian kneeling on their boards brave the 300 km/186.5mi paddle across the Bass Strait. Their adventure lasts several days with stops on small islands along the way. Apart from sharks, currents and threatening waves, win-or-bust Zeb Walsh, Brad Gaul and Jack Bark face sickness, sore muscles and dehydration. Follow their journey on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: Rolex Spirit Of Yachting - Ep.3 - Maxi Yacht Rolex Cup
programme.desc: - Array

programme.title: Vendée Globe Weekly Highlights - Episode 9
programme.desc: - Array

programme.title: The Voyage Of Ghibellina - Episode 3
programme.desc: We have left the island of Stromboli and headed towards the Strait of Messina, the famous stretch that separates Calabria from Sicily. This strait is also famous for the strange games that locals play, sparked by the imagination of ancient sea creatures like Scylla and Charybdis, the monsters that Ullyses had to fight to get back home. Sea monsters, beautiful landscapes and original dishes await us in this episode on board the Ghibellina.

programme.title: The Voyage Of Ghibellina - Episode 1
programme.desc: Our second journey on board Ghibellina begins once again on the harbour of Viareggio, a small coastal town in Tuscany founded in the 16th century. This new voyage will take us along the coast of the islands of Corsica and Sardinia to discover their unique shores, alternating between beautiful stretches of pristine nature and the most well-known resorts in Italy.

programme.title: Sailing To Tokyo - Episode 1
programme.desc: Welcome to Sailing to Tokyo 2020! We begin this first episode by travelling to Sorento in Melbourne, Australia, where the 2020 RS:X Windsurfing World Championships took place. A fleet of 116 sailors from 31 nations gathered in Sorento Sailing Couta Boat Club to challenge for the prestigious titles. Later on, we examine how the Coronavirus pandemic affected an athlete's routine. With the majority of the countries instituting some sort of stay-at-home order, public gatherings of any kind were banned, and numerous sport events were postponed and cancelled.

programme.title: Sailing To Tokyo - Episode 2
programme.desc: - Array

programme.title: Vendée Arctique - Highlights
programme.desc: Skippers are getting ready for the 2022 edition of the Vendée Arctique: the solo race that surrounds Iceland before returning back to Les Sables d'Olonne. Jérémie Beyou became the winner of the 2020 edition of this arduous competition, but seeing the trajectory of Charlie Dalin and Thomas Ruyant, competition is closest than ever. Unpredictability in weather forecasts will force organizers to cut the race short, meaning skippers are running out of time to reduce distances.

programme.title: Sails In Sardinia
programme.desc: Sails in Sardinia takes us to the beautiful Italian island of Sardinia, the sescond largest island in the Mediterranean Sea, to visit the Yacht Club Costa Smeralda, in Porto Cervo. Known for being visited by the rich and famous, it also has a unique sailing history. We will get the true essence of competitive sailing at the Audi Settimana Delle Bocche, where the last leg of the TP52 Super Series is being held. We are meeting Ricardo Bonadeo, Commodore of the yacht club, to understand better how the 1967 non-profit organization has become today a world's leading organizer in international sailing events. Join Andi Van Zyl as she heads to the beautiful Costa Smeralda and interviews other big sailing personalities as Francesco Bruni and Terry Hutchinson, on Sails in Sardinia.

programme.title: Semaine Du Golfe Du Morbihan
programme.desc: The Semaine du Golfe Du Morbihan is an essential event for all classic sailing lovers. The Gulf Week is a maritime even set on the beautiful Morbihan Gulf, in Brittany, a French destination known for its gorgeous landscape. Expending on 35000 hectares, it is worth is reputation as the little sea. For one week, the Gulf will be letting more than 1000 ships rip through its waters. Rowing boats, lightships, classic sailing ships... almost 6000 sailors will take part in this year's edition. This joyful week has been organised in order to meet and share new experiences, so let's enduge in the best moments, most impressive boats and latest news of the 7th edition of the Semaine du Golfe Du Morbihan!

programme.title: A Day At DIBS
programme.desc: Dubai International Boat Show, the most trusted and established marine industry exhibition in the Middle East. Despite misconceptions claiming luxury yachts to be the main attraction in this event, the DIBS offer a much wider variety of expositions on nautical news, sports and lifestyle. It differs from other shows as it has a more exclusive clientele and many professionals of this world are yearning to come.You will adventure into one of Dubai’s most prestigious shows featuring the latest releases of yachts and boats from both local and international builders together with the innovations in marine equipment and accessories.Discover all its secret gems with Nautical Channel.

programme.title: Adidas Sickline Extreme Kayak World Championship Documentary
programme.desc: - Array

programme.title: What the Sea Gives me
programme.desc: What The Sea Gives Me is a feature length documentary comprised of intimate & candid interviews with some of the ocean’s most extraordinary ambassadors including Great White shark researcher Brett McBride, artist Matt Beard, photographer Chris Burkard, bodysurfer Angie Oschmann, conservationist Jean-Michelle Cousteau, free-diver Herbert Nitsch. We give you an honest and personal look through the eyes of those who thrive under the most extreme water conditions, those ensuring the proper care of the oceans for future generations and those who simply derive a sense of pure joy from the sea.

We give you an honest and personal look through the eyes of those who thrive under the most extreme water conditions, those ensuring the proper care of the oceans for future generations and those who simply derive a sense of pure joy from the sea.

programme.title: The Voyage Of Ghibellina - Episode 3
programme.desc: We have left the island of Stromboli and headed towards the Strait of Messina, the famous stretch that separates Calabria from Sicily. This strait is also famous for the strange games that locals play, sparked by the imagination of ancient sea creatures like Scylla and Charybdis, the monsters that Ullyses had to fight to get back home. Sea monsters, beautiful landscapes and original dishes await us in this episode on board the Ghibellina.

programme.title: The Voyage Of Ghibellina - Episode 1
programme.desc: Our second journey on board Ghibellina begins once again on the harbour of Viareggio, a small coastal town in Tuscany founded in the 16th century. This new voyage will take us along the coast of the islands of Corsica and Sardinia to discover their unique shores, alternating between beautiful stretches of pristine nature and the most well-known resorts in Italy.

programme.title: Vendée Arctique - Highlights
programme.desc: Skippers are getting ready for the 2022 edition of the Vendée Arctique: the solo race that surrounds Iceland before returning back to Les Sables d'Olonne. Jérémie Beyou became the winner of the 2020 edition of this arduous competition, but seeing the trajectory of Charlie Dalin and Thomas Ruyant, competition is closest than ever. Unpredictability in weather forecasts will force organizers to cut the race short, meaning skippers are running out of time to reduce distances.

programme.desc: - Array

programme.desc: - Array

programme.desc: - Array

programme.title: Sails In Sardinia
programme.desc: Sails in Sardinia takes us to the beautiful Italian island of Sardinia, the sescond largest island in the Mediterranean Sea, to visit the Yacht Club Costa Smeralda, in Porto Cervo. Known for being visited by the rich and famous, it also has a unique sailing history. We will get the true essence of competitive sailing at the Audi Settimana Delle Bocche, where the last leg of the TP52 Super Series is being held. We are meeting Ricardo Bonadeo, Commodore of the yacht club, to understand better how the 1967 non-profit organization has become today a world's leading organizer in international sailing events. Join Andi Van Zyl as she heads to the beautiful Costa Smeralda and interviews other big sailing personalities as Francesco Bruni and Terry Hutchinson, on Sails in Sardinia.

programme.title: Semaine Du Golfe Du Morbihan
programme.desc: The Semaine du Golfe Du Morbihan is an essential event for all classic sailing lovers. The Gulf Week is a maritime even set on the beautiful Morbihan Gulf, in Brittany, a French destination known for its gorgeous landscape. Expending on 35000 hectares, it is worth is reputation as the little sea. For one week, the Gulf will be letting more than 1000 ships rip through its waters. Rowing boats, lightships, classic sailing ships... almost 6000 sailors will take part in this year's edition. This joyful week has been organised in order to meet and share new experiences, so let's enduge in the best moments, most impressive boats and latest news of the 7th edition of the Semaine du Golfe Du Morbihan!

programme.title: Cape Verdean Kite Crossing
programme.desc: Mitu Monteiro, a Cape Verdean kitesurfer and multi-time world champion, attempts the solo crossing of the twelve volcanic islands of his native archipelago, never accomplished before.Taking on more than 730km of kitesurfing, interspersed with island traverses by only man-powered means totalling approximately 200km, Mitu’s challenges lay ahead of him. With a total trajectory of nearly 1,000km and a route that had to be thought and rethought due to wind direction, shark infested waters, and distances that push this athlete to his limit, sweat will flow and his nerves will surely be put to the test.Mitu’s maverick journey across marvellous Atlantic waters and beaches, through inhospitable lunar landscapes and the lush vegetation of the volcanic islands is truly a SURFARI on a kite. Relive the whole experience on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: P1 USA AquaX - Episode 3 Sarasota, FL
programme.desc: We move to the third round of the AquaX USA Championship that is taking place in Sarasota, FL. Riders will give their all once more in this event filled with adrenaline, power and the ultimate endurance racing. This year, competition is harder than ever as the top participants have been preparing hard for this championship and they are not ready to leave emptyhanded.

programme.title: What the Sea Gives me
programme.desc: What The Sea Gives Me is a feature length documentary comprised of intimate & candid interviews with some of the ocean’s most extraordinary ambassadors including Great White shark researcher Brett McBride, artist Matt Beard, photographer Chris Burkard, bodysurfer Angie Oschmann, conservationist Jean-Michelle Cousteau, free-diver Herbert Nitsch. We give you an honest and personal look through the eyes of those who thrive under the most extreme water conditions, those ensuring the proper care of the oceans for future generations and those who simply derive a sense of pure joy from the sea.

programme.title: Transat Panerai Classique
programme.desc: World Champion Kitesurfer and Nautical Channel host, Bruno Sroka travels to Martinique to welcome the gems of the sea from their Atlantic crossing. The Transat Panerai Classique 2015 is arriving to the Caribbean island. They departed from Lanzarote, in the Canary Islands, and after sailing 3.000nm these classic and historic sailing ships have endured the hardships of the ocean and are eager to arrive in first place for a well deserved victory. Witness some of the most extraordinary yachts ever built and have fun seeing Bruno take the sea on both a traditional Martinique Yoles boat and a Classic European one. Classic Boats, Turquoise Caribbean waters and world champion hosts... what more could we ask for? Enjoy the Transat Panerai Classique 2015 on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: Heineken Regatta - Episode 1
programme.desc: Get ready to rumble in Simpson Bay where the St. Maarten Heineken Regatta will celebrate its 35th anniversary edition! With the official slogan being Serious Fun, it is no wonder people come from over 25 countries to attend this one of a kind regatta. Given this year's lineup, we are expecting some of the best sailing in St. Maarten. Watch the highlights of the 2015 edition!

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 1
programme.desc: Together we’ll travel across the globe and follow the hottest action from the field of Kite! In this Episode, we have the opportunity to witnessup and coming young guns from 4 continents, fighting for their chance to live the Olympic Dream! Dakhla, in Morocco hosts the qualifying event for Europe and Africa, while Pranburi, Thailand is the place where riders from Asia and Oceania will fight for their right to compete in Argentina!

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 2
programme.desc: In this episode we are going to take you into the action from the 2018 milestone event, the International Kiteboarding Association, TT:R Youth Worlds. The fastest young athletes from across the globe have gathered on China’s tropical Hainan Island. With 8 qualification spots available for this year’s Youth Olympic Games in Argentina, expect the competition to be fierce!

programme.title: Maya Gabeira - Return to Nazaré
programme.desc: After a horrible crash in Nazaré that almost took her life, big wave surfer Maya Gabeira fights to overcome physical and mental obstacles and return to surf the giant waves again.Maya Gabeira, the Brazilian surfer that was close to death in 2013 in Nazaré due to big waves. She had to be rescued by lifeguards who struggled to get her out of waves that didn’t stop coming. After recovering physically and emotionally of the shock, she's ready to return to Nazaré to overcome the same obstacles that almost took her life years ago.Her determination is undeniable, as is the danger of tempting fate twice. However, once in Nazaré, will she have the strength needed to surf deathly waves?Follow her inspiring story in Maya Gabeira – Return to Nazaré.

programme.title: Surf The Alps - Zurich Wakeboard
programme.desc: Despite being nestled in the heart of the Swiss Alps, Lake Zurich is home to a wealth of water sports. Journalist Lucia Metzbauer wakeboards with Swiss pros, attends the annual match race, and even tries stand-up paddleboarding before discovering a little-known sport: kanupolo.Also, the International Wakeboard Competition of Züri Fäscht 2013 is taking place in the centre of Zurich, and athletes are ready for Switzerland's greatest freestyle competition in this class. Let's dive into it!

programme.desc: Sails in Sardinia takes us to the beautiful Italian island of Sardinia, the sescond largest island in the Mediterranean Sea, to visit the Yacht Club Costa Smeralda, in Porto Cervo. programme.title: Baltic Sea Goes Sup
programme.desc: What SUP Baltic Sea?Considered a hidden gem for many years, the Baltic Sea is now a retreat for water sports practitioners. People from different parts of the world and cultures join the mesmerising background of the Baltic Sea to practice surfing, sailing and most importantly of all, SUP!Join the worldwide phenomenon of Standup Paddleboarding (SUP) that originated in Hawaii and has finally reached the Baltic Sea.Now available on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: International Surfing Association World Championship - World Adaptive Surfing Championship
programme.desc: This year’s anticipated 2017 ISA World Adaptive Surfing Championship will be held in sunny San Diego in the renown La Jolla neighborhood. The physically challenged surfers participate in teams of up to eight members, and represent their home countries as they race through the waters. With various events and a large following, the Championship is a fun and unique experience; both for the surfers and its spectators.

programme.title: Screen Heroes - Episode 1
programme.desc: In this first episode of Screen Heroes, you can expect some insights in the world of surfing cinema. Today we are in Hamburg, Germany, to check out Hamburg's annual Surf and Skate Festival. Then, we will be taking you to California where we will feature the San Diego Surf Film Festival. Let's go!

programme.title: Screen Heroes - Episode 2
programme.desc: Welcome to today's episode of Screen Heroes! We are in San Sebastian, not only one of Spain's most beautiful cities, but also home to one of the most important surfing festivals in the world. Then, we get transported to the African coastline with The African Project before returning to San Sebastian to discover what's inside the Teatro Principal.

programme.title: Tahitian Swell
programme.desc: The French Polynesia is world famous not only for its clear blue waters, but also for the quality of its waves to the delight of worldwide surfers. These waves are generated by the swell; an undulating movement of the sea surface that advances as it does not break.If the French Polynesia is one of the kingdoms of surfing, it is thanks to its geographical location. Nestled in the heart of the South Pacific, this group of five archipelagos cover an area as vast as Europe and benefit all year round from swells generated by the four winds.The conditions are therefore ideal for the many wave lovers: surfers, windsurfers, bodyboarders... but in order for them to enjoy these conditions, knowledge of marine forecasting is essential. This is where the Polynesian branch of Météo France takes place, including amongst their team swell specialists as Kenji Flohr, a Polynesian forecaster and surfer.His mission is to anticipate the waves that will break on the Polynesian coasts, by analysing the swells, their direction, period, energy, length, and dimensions. The expertise of this surfer forecaster enables to popularize a set of advanced analyses. This makes this didactic documentary accessible to all. And thanks to Kenji Flohr’s crystal clear explanations like the water of the Pacific Ocean, this complex system becomes clear and above all… fascinating.Learn more about the Tahitian Swell and the scientific approach for predicting waves, available on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: World Rowing Beach Sprint - Episode 1
programme.desc: This relatively new exciting format in Coastal Rowing held its first edition of the World Rowing Beach Sprint Finals in Shenzhen, China in 2019. Athletes raced in four boat classes: the mixed double sculls (CMix2x), mixed coxed quadruple sculls (CMix4x+) and men’s and women’s solo (CM1x & CW1x).Watch the best moments of the 2019 edition.

programme.title: Sails In Sardinia
programme.desc: Sails in Sardinia takes us to the beautiful Italian island of Sardinia, the sescond largest island in the Mediterranean Sea, to visit the Yacht Club Costa Smeralda, in Porto Cervo. Known for being visited by the rich and famous, it also has a unique sailing history. We will get the true essence of competitive sailing at the Audi Settimana Delle Bocche, where the last leg of the TP52 Super Series is being held. We are meeting Ricardo Bonadeo, Commodore of the yacht club, to understand better how the 1967 non-profit organization has become today a world's leading organizer in international sailing events. Join Andi Van Zyl as she heads to the beautiful Costa Smeralda and interviews other big sailing personalities as Francesco Bruni and Terry Hutchinson, on Sails in Sardinia.

Today we are in Hamburg, Germany, to check out Hamburg's annual Surf and Skate Festival. Then, we will be taking you to California where we will feature the San Diego Surf Film Festival. Let's go!

programme.title: Screen Heroes - Episode 2
programme.desc: Welcome to today's episode of Screen Heroes! We are in San Sebastian, not only one of Spain's most beautiful cities, but also home to one of the most important surfing festivals in the world. Then, we get transported to the African coastline with The African Project before returning to San Sebastian to discover what's inside the Teatro Principal.

programme.title: What the Sea Gives me
programme.desc: What The Sea Gives Me is a feature length documentary comprised of intimate & candid interviews with some of the ocean’s most extraordinary ambassadors including Great White shark researcher Brett McBride, artist Matt Beard, photographer Chris Burkard, bodysurfer Angie Oschmann, conservationist Jean-Michelle Cousteau, free-diver Herbert Nitsch. We give you an honest and personal look through the eyes of those who thrive under the most extreme water conditions, those ensuring the proper care of the oceans for future generations and those who simply derive a sense of pure joy from the sea.

programme.title: Vendée Arctique - Highlights
programme.desc: Skippers are getting ready for the 2022 edition of the Vendée Arctique: the solo race that surrounds Iceland before returning back to Les Sables d'Olonne. Jérémie Beyou became the winner of the 2020 edition of this arduous competition, but seeing the trajectory of Charlie Dalin and Thomas Ruyant, competition is closest than ever. Unpredictability in weather forecasts will force organizers to cut the race short, meaning skippers are running out of time to reduce distances.

programme.title: Tahiti Pearl Regatta - Episode 1
programme.desc: - Array

programme.title: Wind Masters - Episode 7: Novalja, NP Plitvička jezera, Rijeka, Opatija
programme.desc: - Array

programme.title: Wind Masters - Episode 8: Rab, Mali Lošinj, Cres
programme.desc: - Array

programme.title: The Voyage Of Ghibellina - Episode 3
programme.desc: We have left the island of Stromboli and headed towards the Strait of Messina, the famous stretch that separates Calabria from Sicily. This strait is also famous for the strange games that locals play, sparked by the imagination of ancient sea creatures like Scylla and Charybdis, the monsters that Ullyses had to fight to get back home. Sea monsters, beautiful landscapes and original dishes await us in this episode on board the Ghibellina.

programme.title: The Voyage Of Ghibellina - Episode 1
programme.desc: Our second journey on board Ghibellina begins once again on the harbour of Viareggio, a small coastal town in Tuscany founded in the 16th century. This new voyage will take us along the coast of the islands of Corsica and Sardinia to discover their unique shores, alternating between beautiful stretches of pristine nature and the most well-known resorts in Italy.

programme.title: P1 USA Offshore - Episode 3 - Sheboygan
programme.desc: - Array

programme.title: P1 USA AquaX - Episode 4 Great Lakes, MI
programme.desc: Welcome to the Great Lakes, Michigan!The Great Lakes Grand Prix has returned to Michigan City, and it is the city's largest event to the delight of both racers and fans. They made sure they came back bigger and better, and with unbeatable water conditions, powerboat teams are in for a challenge. Watch the best moments of the fourth round of the P1 USA AquaX Championship.

programme.title: Sails In Sardinia
programme.desc: Sails in Sardinia takes us to the beautiful Italian island of Sardinia, the sescond largest island in the Mediterranean Sea, to visit the Yacht Club Costa Smeralda, in Porto Cervo. Known for being visited by the rich and famous, it also has a unique sailing history. We will get the true essence of competitive sailing at the Audi Settimana Delle Bocche, where the last leg of the TP52 Super Series is being held. We are meeting Ricardo Bonadeo, Commodore of the yacht club, to understand better how the 1967 non-profit organization has become today a world's leading organizer in international sailing events. Join Andi Van Zyl as she heads to the beautiful Costa Smeralda and interviews other big sailing personalities as Francesco Bruni and Terry Hutchinson, on Sails in Sardinia.

programme.title: Semaine Du Golfe Du Morbihan
programme.desc: The Semaine du Golfe Du Morbihan is an essential event for all classic sailing lovers. The Gulf Week is a maritime even set on the beautiful Morbihan Gulf, in Brittany, a French destination known for its gorgeous landscape. Expending on 35000 hectares, it is worth is reputation as the little sea. For one week, the Gulf will be letting more than 1000 ships rip through its waters. Rowing boats, lightships, classic sailing ships... almost 6000 sailors will take part in this year's edition. This joyful week has been organised in order to meet and share new experiences, so let's enduge in the best moments, most impressive boats and latest news of the 7th edition of the Semaine du Golfe Du Morbihan!

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 1
programme.desc: Together we’ll travel across the globe and follow the hottest action from the field of Kite! In this Episode, we have the opportunity to witnessup and coming young guns from 4 continents, fighting for their chance to live the Olympic Dream! Dakhla, in Morocco hosts the qualifying event for Europe and Africa, while Pranburi, Thailand is the place where riders from Asia and Oceania will fight for their right to compete in Argentina!

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 2
programme.desc: In this episode we are going to take you into the action from the 2018 milestone event, the International Kiteboarding Association, TT:R Youth Worlds. The fastest young athletes from across the globe have gathered on China’s tropical Hainan Island. With 8 qualification spots available for this year’s Youth Olympic Games in Argentina, expect the competition to be fierce!

programme.title: PRADA Cup - Round Robin 1-2 Week 1
programme.desc: Every match of the PRADA Cup is a one-on-one duel of strategy and tactics, and time is of the essence. The Round Robins will define who will pass directly into the final and who, on the other hand, will have to compete in the semi-final before moving forward to the final.The first to win 7 races will move directly into the final of the competition. Luna Rossa Prada Pirelli, INEOS Team UK and NYYC American Magic are the three contenders in this year's Round Robin. Who will move on directly to the final? Find it out, on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: Qatar Airways GKA Kite World Tour - Episode 1
programme.desc: - Array

programme.title: The Voyage Of Ghibellina - Episode 2
programme.desc: We are ready to visit in this episode the most luxurious resorts along the Sardinian Costa Smeralda, spending our days diving into the sea and enjoying the relaxing beaches. We will sail Ghibellina to the Sardinian archipelago of La Maddalena and continue to the Corsican town of Bonifacio to discover its fascinating history.

programme.title: The Voyage Of Ghibellina - Episode 3
programme.desc: We leave the French harbour in Bonifacio and head to the nearby islands of Lavezzi and Cavallo. These uninhabited islets are part of a small archipelago in the infamous Strait of Bonifacio. Waters are dangerous in this area: almost every skerry, shoal and cliff has a long record of shipwrecks and sea disasters. How will Ghibellina overcome this new challenge and arrive unharmed to safe port?

programme.title: Sailing To Tokyo - Episode 3
programme.desc: This time we are going to focus on another exciting Olympic class, the RS:X. The RS:X was first introduced at the 2008 Olympic Games in China. Being the most affordable yachting class eligible for competition in the Olympics, it has been taken up by a large number of sailors from more than 60 nations over 6 continents competing at numerous regattas worldwide.Stay tuned for the next episode as we follow the sailing action around the world! The final countdown for the Olympics in Tokyo has only just begun!

programme.title: Sailing To Tokyo - Episode 4
programme.desc: Welcome to the fourth episode of Sailing to Tokyo 2020, in this month’s episode we will focus on two classes that we will be introduced to the Olympics for Paris 2024. iQFOiL and KiteSurfing are set to make their Summer Olympic debut in Marseille after being approved as two out of the ten sailing events on the programme.Vanora ENGADINWIND by Dakine, is one of the most famous water sport events in the world and at this windsurfing festival various events take place, including some freestyle action. Held annually during August on Lake Silvaplana, it attracts some of the best athletes the water sport world has to showcase. Let's dive into the action!

programme.title: Discovering Karpathos - Part 1
programme.desc: We are set to visit the rich in tradition village of Olimpos and to swim in the clear waters of some of the most beautiful beaches in the Mediterranean. Then, we will discover some of the secrets by the seabed of the island and the creatures that inhabit them. This episode would not be complete without trying a watersport, so we will try to fly on to a kitesurf. Will you fly away with us?

programme.title: Discovering Karpathos - Part 2
programme.desc: We take a stroll down the village of Arkansa, in the middle of Karpathos. The village is loved by tourists who have been coming for over 20 years. Then, we are going to explore some of the ruins of the island, starting in the north in the ancient Vrikous. The island is filled with Ancient Greek ruins we cannot miss on before boarding on a windsurf experience. With the Meltemi wind, Karpathos has become a windsurfing paradise.

Today we are in Hamburg, Germany, to check out Hamburg's annual Surf and Skate Festival. Then, we will be taking you to California where we will feature the San Diego Surf Film Festival. Let's go!

programme.title: Screen Heroes - Episode 2
programme.desc: Welcome to today's episode of Screen Heroes! We are in San Sebastian, not only one of Spain's most beautiful cities, but also home to one of the most important surfing festivals in the world. Then, we get transported to the African coastline with The African Project before returning to San Sebastian to discover what's inside the Teatro Principal.

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 1
programme.desc: Together we’ll travel across the globe and follow the hottest action from the field of Kite! In this Episode, we have the opportunity to witnessup and coming young guns from 4 continents, fighting for their chance to live the Olympic Dream! Dakhla, in Morocco hosts the qualifying event for Europe and Africa, while Pranburi, Thailand is the place where riders from Asia and Oceania will fight for their right to compete in Argentina!

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 2
programme.desc: In this episode we are going to take you into the action from the 2018 milestone event, the International Kiteboarding Association, TT:R Youth Worlds. The fastest young athletes from across the globe have gathered on China’s tropical Hainan Island. With 8 qualification spots available for this year’s Youth Olympic Games in Argentina, expect the competition to be fierce!

programme.title: P1 USA Offshore - Episode 3 - Sheboygan
programme.desc: - Array

programme.title: P1 USA AquaX - Episode 4 Great Lakes, MI
programme.desc: Welcome to the Great Lakes, Michigan!The Great Lakes Grand Prix has returned to Michigan City, and it is the city's largest event to the delight of both racers and fans. They made sure they came back bigger and better, and with unbeatable water conditions, powerboat teams are in for a challenge. Watch the best moments of the fourth round of the P1 USA AquaX Championship.

programme.title: 52 Super Series - Episode 1
programme.desc: - Array

programme.title: Qatar Airways GKA Kite World Tour - Episode 1
programme.desc: - Array

programme.title: The Voyage Of Ghibellina - Episode 2
programme.desc: We are ready to visit in this episode the most luxurious resorts along the Sardinian Costa Smeralda, spending our days diving into the sea and enjoying the relaxing beaches. We will sail Ghibellina to the Sardinian archipelago of La Maddalena and continue to the Corsican town of Bonifacio to discover its fascinating history.

programme.title: The Voyage Of Ghibellina - Episode 3
programme.desc: We leave the French harbour in Bonifacio and head to the nearby islands of Lavezzi and Cavallo. These uninhabited islets are part of a small archipelago in the infamous Strait of Bonifacio. Waters are dangerous in this area: almost every skerry, shoal and cliff has a long record of shipwrecks and sea disasters. How will Ghibellina overcome this new challenge and arrive unharmed to safe port?

programme.title: Discovering Karpathos - Part 1
programme.desc: We are set to visit the rich in tradition village of Olimpos and to swim in the clear waters of some of the most beautiful beaches in the Mediterranean. Then, we will discover some of the secrets by the seabed of the island and the creatures that inhabit them. This episode would not be complete without trying a watersport, so we will try to fly on to a kitesurf. Will you fly away with us?

programme.title: Discovering Karpathos - Part 2
programme.desc: We take a stroll down the village of Arkansa, in the middle of Karpathos. The village is loved by tourists who have been coming for over 20 years. Then, we are going to explore some of the ruins of the island, starting in the north in the ancient Vrikous. The island is filled with Ancient Greek ruins we cannot miss on before boarding on a windsurf experience. With the Meltemi wind, Karpathos has become a windsurfing paradise.

programme.title: Shifting Ice + Changing Tides
programme.desc: In March 2014 six women set sail from Iceland with the intention of sailing across the Denmark Strait and up the west coast of Greenland. Shifting Ice and Changing Tides' is a unique human and wind powered, female led, ski and sail expedition that is captivating for the beauty of its white, gelid landscape.In this remote, fascinating and beautiful region, six women will explore and ski first descents while limiting their environmental footprint by sailing and climbing. The expedition will serve as a platform for raising awareness about climate change and environmental issues as well as for inspiring and promoting female participation in snow sports adventures.Join them as they adventure in the wilderness to collect scientific data in one of the most incredible and deathly climates. This is their story.

programme.title: Voiles de Legende 2013
programme.desc: Welcome to La Baule, in Brittany, for the 11th edition of the Voiles de Legende. We have wonderful weather conditions this year and the line-up is filled with many classic boats, like the Pen Duick, some Fife boats and also the Metre-class boats with a very special guest: France, the first French challenger for the America's Cup launched by Baron Bich in 1970. Come see this gathering of big boats in La Baule's port as we prepare to set sail with these legendary boats.

programme.title: Gulf of Mexico
programme.desc: Beppe Faresin is an extreme kayaker with a dream: venturing into the Gulf of Mexico on a kayak. In this adventure, he will kayak his way through the Mexican lagoons and swamps to discover the wild nature of this unique country. Faresin is already famous for raising funds for UNICEF while paddling in rivers and oceans all over the world. Now, he faces a new challenge: crossing the Gulf of Mexico by himself. For almost 1500 km, this apparently fearless athlete will discover corners of Mexico otherwise unreachable by land. Follow his challenge navigating through the Gulf and find out what happens along the way.

programme.title: Why Not Whitewater?
programme.desc: Welcome to Dimaro, the Rafting Center Val di Sole. Our story begins in 1982 when a group of adventurers decided to make history by being the first humans to raft down the River Noce. Not only they managed to go down the river against all odds, but they also fell in love with its beautiful landscapes and decided to share it with the rest of the world.Why Not Whitewater? takes us on a journey to the north of Italy to explore the valleys and rivers in the most adventurous ways. From canoening to kayaking and from rafting to hydrospeed, we are set to live an odyssey filled with adrenaline and fun that will leave you wondeing why not white water this summer!

programme.title: Heineken Regatta - Episode 1
programme.desc: The St. Maarten Heineken Regatta is about to celebrate its 36th edition. This world renowned sailing event offers four days of World Class Racing, with trade winds coming from the North East, an average temperature of 25°C and crystal clear waters. Courses will take participants along coastal races, as well as around the island, presenting the beautiful beaches, rock formations and other scenery. On shore, participants and visitors will be able to enjoy the culture, cuisine and music from both the Dutch and French side. Are you going to miss out? Come dive in at the 2016 Heineken Regatta!

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 3
programme.desc: Immediately after the final spots for the Youth Olympic Games were decided in China, the International Kiteboarding Association, together with Hang Loose Beach host the 2018 TwinTip Racing Open World Championships and 59 competitors of all ages from 19 nations are getting ready for the next intense battles.

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 4
programme.desc: In this episode, we’re going to follow the action of the 2018 KiteFoil World Series. The World Series tour is the sport’s premium series with events happening around the globe and a strong focus on media production and large prize money payouts.

programme.title: La Ruta de la Sal - Ruta de la Sal 2023
programme.desc: - Array

programme.title: Surf The Alps - Munich
programme.desc: Munich, Germany, close to the Alps, but far away from the sea. In Munich, instead of waiting for vacations, surfers started experimenting on the 12m, 39ft wave in the Eisbach in the middle of the city 30 years ago.This way, river surfing was born. Nowadays, the wave is surfed day and night, during all seasons, attracting surf legends and tourists. But now the city wants to shut down the wave!

How will Ghibellina overcome this new challenge and arrive unharmed to safe port?

programme.title: International Surfing Association World Championship - World Longboard Surfing Championship
programme.desc: An acclaimed competition thanks to the singularity of the longboard, this year’s 2018 ISA World Longboard Championship is back in the races. This year the competition will see 71 athletes from 22 nations surfing for the podium. And thanks to this year’s high-end location in Wanning, China, the championship will be even more exciting. Join us as we watch the best moments of this anticipated event!

programme.title: Screen Heroes - Episode 3
programme.desc: On this episode, we are going to check out the Surf at Lisbon Film Fest in Portugal. Lisbon has a lot more to offer than just world-class waves, and we are ready to dive into the film action. Come join us as we visit this important surfing festival and take a close look behind the scenes!

programme.title: Screen Heroes - Episode 4
programme.desc: In today's episode of Screen Heroes we land in France. Before we check out the 10th edition of the International Surf Film Festival in Anglet we will be taking a closer look at this beautiful region. In the first win of the festival, Garrett Mcnamara's search for the world's biggest wave in Nazare has left us mesmerized. Will the rest of the movies cause the same impact?

programme.title: Skagerrak
programme.desc: SKAGERRAK follows the preparation and mental development of the Danish professional stand up paddle athlete Casper Steinfath in his attempt to be the first person in the world to paddle from Denmark to Norway.In his journey, brotherhood and friendship come to play an essential part making a dream and project like the crossing of an entire ocean come true. SKAGERRAK will take you behind the scenes of mainstream media and portrays the Northern and secluded region of Denmark called Thy, where Casper grew up.A region, where a pioneer spirit and desire for independence prevails despite adversity and isolation. SKAGERRAK is an inspirational story that touches upon the dreams, aspirations, and desires that live inside all of us. A film about the courage to reach for the horizon.

programme.title: Gulf of Mexico
programme.desc: Beppe Faresin is an extreme kayaker with a dream: venturing into the Gulf of Mexico on a kayak. In this adventure, he will kayak his way through the Mexican lagoons and swamps to discover the wild nature of this unique country. Faresin is already famous for raising funds for UNICEF while paddling in rivers and oceans all over the world. Now, he faces a new challenge: crossing the Gulf of Mexico by himself. For almost 1500 km, this apparently fearless athlete will discover corners of Mexico otherwise unreachable by land. Follow his challenge navigating through the Gulf and find out what happens along the way.

programme.title: 52 Super Series - Episode 1
programme.desc: - Array

programme.title: Discovering Karpathos - Part 1
programme.desc: We are set to visit the rich in tradition village of Olimpos and to swim in the clear waters of some of the most beautiful beaches in the Mediterranean. Then, we will discover some of the secrets by the seabed of the island and the creatures that inhabit them. This episode would not be complete without trying a watersport, so we will try to fly on to a kitesurf. Will you fly away with us?

programme.title: Discovering Karpathos - Part 2
programme.desc: We take a stroll down the village of Arkansa, in the middle of Karpathos. The village is loved by tourists who have been coming for over 20 years. Then, we are going to explore some of the ruins of the island, starting in the north in the ancient Vrikous. The island is filled with Ancient Greek ruins we cannot miss on before boarding on a windsurf experience. With the Meltemi wind, Karpathos has become a windsurfing paradise.

How will Ghibellina overcome this new challenge and arrive unharmed to safe port?

programme.desc: Moving on from the Great Lakes Grand Prix, riders advance to St. Petersburg, Florida, for the last event of the P1 AquaX 2021 Championship. This event involves high-speed watercraft racing action, and competitors face each other against the clock to determine this season's ultimate winner. Start your engines and come race with us!

programme.title: 52 Super Series - Episode 1
programme.desc: - Array

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 3
programme.desc: Immediately after the final spots for the Youth Olympic Games were decided in China, the International Kiteboarding Association, together with Hang Loose Beach host the 2018 TwinTip Racing Open World Championships and 59 competitors of all ages from 19 nations are getting ready for the next intense battles.

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 4
programme.desc: In this episode, we’re going to follow the action of the 2018 KiteFoil World Series. The World Series tour is the sport’s premium series with events happening around the globe and a strong focus on media production and large prize money payouts.

programme.title: Gulf of Mexico
programme.desc: Beppe Faresin is an extreme kayaker with a dream: venturing into the Gulf of Mexico on a kayak. In this adventure, he will kayak his way through the Mexican lagoons and swamps to discover the wild nature of this unique country. Faresin is already famous for raising funds for UNICEF while paddling in rivers and oceans all over the world. Now, he faces a new challenge: crossing the Gulf of Mexico by himself. For almost 1500 km, this apparently fearless athlete will discover corners of Mexico otherwise unreachable by land. Follow his challenge navigating through the Gulf and find out what happens along the way.

programme.title: Discovering Karpathos - Part 1
programme.desc: We are set to visit the rich in tradition village of Olimpos and to swim in the clear waters of some of the most beautiful beaches in the Mediterranean. Then, we will discover some of the secrets by the seabed of the island and the creatures that inhabit them. This episode would not be complete without trying a watersport, so we will try to fly on to a kitesurf. Will you fly away with us?

programme.title: Discovering Karpathos - Part 2
programme.desc: We take a stroll down the village of Arkansa, in the middle of Karpathos. The village is loved by tourists who have been coming for over 20 years. Then, we are going to explore some of the ruins of the island, starting in the north in the ancient Vrikous. The island is filled with Ancient Greek ruins we cannot miss on before boarding on a windsurf experience. With the Meltemi wind, Karpathos has become a windsurfing paradise.

programme.desc: - Array

programme.title: Screen Heroes - Episode 3
programme.desc: On this episode, we are going to check out the Surf at Lisbon Film Fest in Portugal. Lisbon has a lot more to offer than just world-class waves, and we are ready to dive into the film action. Come join us as we visit this important surfing festival and take a close look behind the scenes!

programme.title: Screen Heroes - Episode 4
programme.desc: In today's episode of Screen Heroes we land in France. Before we check out the 10th edition of the International Surf Film Festival in Anglet we will be taking a closer look at this beautiful region. In the first win of the festival, Garrett Mcnamara's search for the world's biggest wave in Nazare has left us mesmerized. Will the rest of the movies cause the same impact?

programme.title: The Voyage Of Ghibellina - Episode 2
programme.desc: We are ready to visit in this episode the most luxurious resorts along the Sardinian Costa Smeralda, spending our days diving into the sea and enjoying the relaxing beaches. We will sail Ghibellina to the Sardinian archipelago of La Maddalena and continue to the Corsican town of Bonifacio to discover its fascinating history.

programme.title: The Voyage Of Ghibellina - Episode 3
programme.desc: We leave the French harbour in Bonifacio and head to the nearby islands of Lavezzi and Cavallo. These uninhabited islets are part of a small archipelago in the infamous Strait of Bonifacio. Waters are dangerous in this area: almost every skerry, shoal and cliff has a long record of shipwrecks and sea disasters. How will Ghibellina overcome this new challenge and arrive unharmed to safe port?

programme.title: Transat Jacques Vabre - Episode 1 Departure
programme.desc: In the 2013 edition of the The 'Transat Jacques Vabre' the multihulls and monohulls start at Le Havre and are set to arrive to Itajai in Brazil. For even a shot at victory in this extreme test of endurance and maritime skill, each team must find a way to maintain a world class sailing performance all while living together under excruciating conditions.Watch the departure and start of the Transat Jacques Vabre 2013, available on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: Transat Jacques Vabre - Episode 2 Arrival
programme.desc: The multihulls and monohulls are competing to the extreme in order to arrive in first place at Itajai in Brazil. After the non-stop 5,450 nautical mile course from France to Brazil, the skippers see the bright light ahead and rush towards Brazilian shores. What team will be the ultimate winner of this year's edition of the Transat Jacques Vabre? Find out on the 2013 edition of this transatlantic ocean competition.

programme.title: PRADA Cup - Round Robin 3 Week 2
programme.desc: The Round Robin competition continues as teams face each other in 4 rounds to determine who will advance to the final and who will have to compete in a semi-final before heading to the final of the Prada Cup.Get ready to see INEOS Team UK, NYYC American Magic and Luna Rossa Prada Pirelli compete ferociously in one of the top competitions of sailing.

programme.title: The World Sailing Show - Episode 11
programme.desc: - Array

programme.title: The Voyage Of Ghibellina - Episode 1
programme.desc: Ghibellina cruises through to Season 3 of the Voyage of the Ghibellina. As usual, we start our journey in the port of Viareggio. This time however, we will be heading towards southern Italy. Our first stop is Ustica, the small volcanic island to the north of Sicily. We are on a mission to discover the capital of Sicily, Palermo, and explore its rich and diverse history.

programme.title: The Voyage Of Ghibellina - Episode 2
programme.desc: This time, we set sail to see the beautiful city of Trapani, a city that has always been closely connected to the sea. One of the most clear signs of the city's connection to the sea is its fish market, here we can find all kind of fishes from the area and get a better sense of the local cuisine. Ghibellina is also setting course to the Aegadian Islands and towards the island of Favignana.

programme.title: Sailing To Tokyo - Episode 5
programme.desc: Hello and welcome to the fifth episode of Sailing to Tokyo 2020! We continue with more sailing action from the current fastest Olympic sailing classes, in Lake Attersee, Austria for the 2020 Forward WIP 49er, 49er FX & Nacra 17 European Championships. After many cancellations due to the Covid pandemic this event was the most important for these Olympic classes in 2020.Get on board with us as we go Sailing to Tokyo!

programme.title: Sailing To Tokyo - Episode 6
programme.desc: To end the season we focus on one class that will be introduced for Paris 2024. Kiteboarding is set to make its summer Olympic debut in Marseille after being approved as two of the then sailing events on the programme. We will also head to Italy's Genoa to focus on the L30 class, which is a candidate to become an Olympic class in Paris 2024. In this majestic Italian city, the 2020 EUROSAF Mixed Offshore European Championships took place with some of the most legendary sailors participating. Let's get going!

programme.title: Posh Port - Madeira
programme.desc: In this episode, host Andi van Zyl gets an inside look at the eco-friendly Quinta do Lorde of Portugal's Madeira island. We will interview the Marina Manager at this dazzling destination and Andi will explore the marina and surrounding coastline. Then, she will learn how to cook a delicious traditional platter and even go sailing taking a dive with dolphins!

programme.title: Posh Port - Montenegro
programme.desc: Posh Ports is a new Nautical Channel original series which takes viewers on exclusive tours of the world’s most extravagant marinas, and yacht clubs! In this episode, host Andrew Miller gets an inside look at the luxurious Porto Montenegro, explores the surrounding coastline, and puts his safety on the line wakeboarding in the marina!

This event involves high-speed watercraft racing action, and competitors face each other against the clock to determine this season's ultimate winner. Start your engines and come race with us!

programme.title: Transat Jacques Vabre - Episode 1 Departure
programme.desc: In the 2013 edition of the The 'Transat Jacques Vabre' the multihulls and monohulls start at Le Havre and are set to arrive to Itajai in Brazil. For even a shot at victory in this extreme test of endurance and maritime skill, each team must find a way to maintain a world class sailing performance all while living together under excruciating conditions.Watch the departure and start of the Transat Jacques Vabre 2013, available on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: Transat Jacques Vabre - Episode 2 Arrival
programme.desc: The multihulls and monohulls are competing to the extreme in order to arrive in first place at Itajai in Brazil. After the non-stop 5,450 nautical mile course from France to Brazil, the skippers see the bright light ahead and rush towards Brazilian shores. What team will be the ultimate winner of this year's edition of the Transat Jacques Vabre? Find out on the 2013 edition of this transatlantic ocean competition.

programme.title: The World Sailing Show - Episode 11
programme.desc: - Array

programme.title: The Voyage Of Ghibellina - Episode 1
programme.desc: Ghibellina cruises through to Season 3 of the Voyage of the Ghibellina. As usual, we start our journey in the port of Viareggio. This time however, we will be heading towards southern Italy. Our first stop is Ustica, the small volcanic island to the north of Sicily. We are on a mission to discover the capital of Sicily, Palermo, and explore its rich and diverse history.

programme.title: The Voyage Of Ghibellina - Episode 2
programme.desc: This time, we set sail to see the beautiful city of Trapani, a city that has always been closely connected to the sea. One of the most clear signs of the city's connection to the sea is its fish market, here we can find all kind of fishes from the area and get a better sense of the local cuisine. Ghibellina is also setting course to the Aegadian Islands and towards the island of Favignana.

programme.title: Posh Port - Madeira
programme.desc: In this episode, host Andi van Zyl gets an inside look at the eco-friendly Quinta do Lorde of Portugal's Madeira island. We will interview the Marina Manager at this dazzling destination and Andi will explore the marina and surrounding coastline. Then, she will learn how to cook a delicious traditional platter and even go sailing taking a dive with dolphins!

programme.title: Posh Port - Montenegro
programme.desc: Posh Ports is a new Nautical Channel original series which takes viewers on exclusive tours of the world’s most extravagant marinas, and yacht clubs! In this episode, host Andrew Miller gets an inside look at the luxurious Porto Montenegro, explores the surrounding coastline, and puts his safety on the line wakeboarding in the marina!

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 3
programme.desc: Immediately after the final spots for the Youth Olympic Games were decided in China, the International Kiteboarding Association, together with Hang Loose Beach host the 2018 TwinTip Racing Open World Championships and 59 competitors of all ages from 19 nations are getting ready for the next intense battles.

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 4
programme.desc: In this episode, we’re going to follow the action of the 2018 KiteFoil World Series. The World Series tour is the sport’s premium series with events happening around the globe and a strong focus on media production and large prize money payouts.

programme.title: Clipper: The Race Of Their Lives - Episode 1
programme.desc: Welcome to the eleventh edition of the biennial race of Clipper: The Race of Their Lives. 700 participants representing over 40 nations will take on the challenge of dealing with whatever 'Mother Nature' has in store. They will battle the elements out on the world's greatest oceans and will experiences the toughest conditions imaginable: from hurricane force winds to squalls that can knock a boat flat. Find out now what will happen in this unique challenge.

programme.title: Jump On Board - Episode 1
programme.desc: Today we are at the Gran Lasco sailing club, located in the very heart of Rome. Its president, Franco Guerrieri will help us achieve our skipper licence so we can go sail on our ship. Then, we travel to Mykonos to try Greek food and wander its streets. Are you coming with us?

programme.title: Jump On Board - Episode 2
programme.desc: After spending 2 days in Mykonos, where food was at the centre of our attention, we are finally on board and sailing towards Tinos. However, we encounter some problems and have to head back to Mykonos, and we take the time to meet the Mayor before heading back into the water.

programme.title: Screen Heroes - Episode 3
programme.desc: On this episode, we are going to check out the Surf at Lisbon Film Fest in Portugal. Lisbon has a lot more to offer than just world-class waves, and we are ready to dive into the film action. Come join us as we visit this important surfing festival and take a close look behind the scenes!

programme.title: Screen Heroes - Episode 4
programme.desc: In today's episode of Screen Heroes we land in France. Before we check out the 10th edition of the International Surf Film Festival in Anglet we will be taking a closer look at this beautiful region. In the first win of the festival, Garrett Mcnamara's search for the world's biggest wave in Nazare has left us mesmerized. Will the rest of the movies cause the same impact?

programme.title: Jump On Board - Episode 1

programme.title: The World Sailing Show - Episode 1
programme.desc: On this month’s show we will witness the first capsize of an AC75 caught on video as America’s Cup Defenders Emirates Team New Zealand took a tumble off Auckland Harbour. We also dive into the climax of the Brest Atlantiques which saw some of the greatest sailors race the biggest trimarans around the Atlantic. Next, we will update you on SailGP's two new teams for the new season and action from the Grand Finale of the Star Sailors League in the Bahamas. Plenty of end of season world championships have recently taken place - we bring you the action and the new world medallists from Kiteboarding, Windsurfing and three sailing classes.

programme.title: The World Sailing Show - Episode 2
programme.desc: On this episode we start a new series building up to this summer’s Olympic Games, and we will be looking at the favourites for medals in the 470 and bring you our guide to the sailing venue in Enoshima. Then, the Sydney to Hobart is a highlight of the sailing calendar but the 75th edition was particularly special with the largest fleet in many years. We tell the story of the race and hear from the winners.Later on in The World Sailing Show, the longest intercontinental race of the southern hemisphere gets off to a flying start. We’re on board Maserati multi 70 to hear how Italy’s favourite sailor Giovanni Soldini plans to win the Cape to Rio race.Also, for the first time in its 63 year history the Finn Gold Cup was won by a New Zealander – we find out how he did it.Come join us as we embark into the world of sailing!

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 5
programme.desc: In this episode we’ll continue to follow the action of the 2018 KiteFoil World Series. We’ll reveal the new World Champions crowned in Cagliari, Italy at the final event of the series, the 2018 Sardinia Kiteboard Grand Slam.

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 6
programme.desc: As kiteboarding becomes more popular and accessible to the masses, the hopes of many turn towards the Olympic Games. Although shaken, the spirit of the kiteboarders and their steadfast refusal to be defeated is rewarded with a vote of inclusion for the Youth Games in 2018 for the very first time. Yet again the Olympic dreams of the kiteboarders are on the line as the sport comes up for consideration for the Tokyo Games 2020.

programme.title: Journey To Giglio
programme.desc: On January of 2012 the Italian cruise ship Costa Concordia sank in shallow waters after striking an underwater rock off Isola del Giglio. Many things remained unclear about this tragedy, so Andi van Zyl is set to discover the truth regarding this incident.Journey to Giglio is an investigative piece on the infamous Costa Concordia tragedy. Andi van Zyl is on the Italian island of Giglio for an exclusive exposé on the shipwreck that shocked the world. She will leave no rock unturned as she digs into what happened the night of the accident and uncovers the disaster’s impact on the local residents and economy.Highlights include exploration of the island and disaster site, and an interview with the man at the helm of the salvage operation, Nick Sloane. Andi sits down with the fellow South African to discuss the delicate process of freeing the wrecked cruise-liner from the reef without spoiling the pristine waters of Giglio Island.Find out the mystery behind the sinking of Costa Concordia on this Journey to Giglio.

programme.title: Surf The Alps - Winter Kiting In St Moritz
programme.desc: The ice cold winter of Switzerland, wind, a board and a kite! Welcome to the adventure of winter kiting! Join us as we visit the oldest snowkiting school in the world and admire the action the snowkiting legends put up. All of this on the immense frozen Silvaplana Lake in the middle of the highest peaks of the Swiss Alps.

programme.title: Transat Jacques Vabre - Episode 2 Arrival
programme.desc: The multihulls and monohulls are competing to the extreme in order to arrive in first place at Itajai in Brazil. After the non-stop 5,450 nautical mile course from France to Brazil, the skippers see the bright light ahead and rush towards Brazilian shores. What team will be the ultimate winner of this year's edition of the Transat Jacques Vabre? Find out on the 2013 edition of this transatlantic ocean competition.

programme.title: The Voyage Of Ghibellina - Episode 1
programme.desc: Ghibellina cruises through to Season 3 of the Voyage of the Ghibellina. As usual, we start our journey in the port of Viareggio. programme.title: The Voyage Of Ghibellina - Episode 2
programme.desc: This time, we set sail to see the beautiful city of Trapani, a city that has always been closely connected to the sea. One of the most clear signs of the city's connection to the sea is its fish market, here we can find all kind of fishes from the area and get a better sense of the local cuisine. Ghibellina is also setting course to the Aegadian Islands and towards the island of Favignana.
